We believe skills and experience are transferrable, and the desire to dream big makes for great candidates.Team  This role will be reporting to Director, Security Engineering. The security engineering org targets building state-of-the-art technology that will help reduce the risk surrounding the sensitive assets of the company with the least impact possible on operations, acts as guidance and facilitator to the security operations teams and helps shifting Security perception from blocker to enabler by building a relationship of trust with the other teams. The Endpoint Security Engineering team is part of larger Security Engineering org. The team’s mission is to provide best-in-class security to end-user devices and protect against cyber threats.Job Description What you get to do in this role: Implement security measures using DevSecOps framework to protect Mac & Windows laptops, VDIs, Mobile devices, Browsers, Email, Managed/Unmanaged software, IoT devices
Implement user trust and device trust for managed and unmanaged endpoints
Implement security posture management for managed and unmanaged endpoints
Secure access to corporate, commercial, and regulated markets network from endpoints
Deploy Endpoint Detection Response across the enterprise
Collaborate with Insider Threat team to create DLP policies for hosts, network, email, and apps
Collaborate with DG team to build connectors that perform data scan on critical assets
Manage privileged access for endpoints
Manage credential vaulting and rotation for corporate assets and endpoints 
Participate in security incidents and help implement the containment and eradication. 
Remediation of audit findings.
Accountable for the timely delivery of projects as per established roadmaps by working closely with the business teams To be successful in this role you have: A Computer Science/Engineering degree with 4+ years of proven, related experience is required
5+ years of proven experience in endpoint or infrastructure security
Good understanding of DevSecOps and CI/CD principles, with experience integrating security into these practices
Solid understanding of cloud architecture, Linux and Windows OS and networking concepts
Hands-on experience with security tooling and technologies
Experience with Automation (Python, Perl, bash scripting, etc.) 
Experience with EPM (JAMF, SCCM etc.) and MDM and MAM (Intune, AirWatch etc.) solutions   
Experience in Linux, Windows, Mac systems security.  
Experience/Knowledge with security tools including (not limited to): Anti-Malware and Endpoint Detection Response (CrowdStrike)
Networking Security (Firewalls, NAC, Zero Trust, etc.) 
Logging and Aggregation tools 
Deception technologies 
Vulnerability scanning (Wiz, Tenable)
Privileged Access Management- Privileged Session Management (PAM-PSM) (BeyondTrust EPM/PSM)
Data Loss prevention tools (DLP) (Microsoft Information Purview, Cososys, Zscaler, O365)
Data Governance solutions (BigID)ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.
